Name: Y Combinator
Perks: $500k funding on 2 separate safes: $125k on a post-money safe in return for 7%, $375k on an uncapped safe with a Most Favored Nation (“MFN”) provision; each founder is assigned a dedicated group partner who has mentored hundreds of YC companies; free credits or significant discounts on hosting, banking, cap table management, back office, and much more; access to over 9000 YC alumni through private social network Bookface; access to YC Investor Database which has profiles and reviews for more than 50,000 startup investors
Qualifications: Open to any startup
One-line description: A venture capital firm and startup accelerator that helps early-stage entrepreneurs.

Name: Anthology Fund
Perks: over $100k funding; $25k Anthropic credits; regular access to the Anthropic team; quarterly deep dives with Menlo and Anthropic leaders and developer relations team; biannual demo days hosted by the Menlo partners and Anthropic leaders; credits from Menlo Ventures’ companies; fractional workspace access in Menlo Ventures’ SF and Menlo Park offices
Qualifications: For Pre-Seed, Seed, or Series A; prefer to invest in companies based in the U.S.
One-line description: A $100 million venture capital fund launched by Menlo Ventures and Anthropic designed to invest in and accelerate the growth of early-stage startups.

Name: Grayscale VC
Perks: $300k-$1M variable funding; $500k in credits from major cloud providers, OpenAI, and more
Qualifications: N/A
One-line description: A venture capital firm primarily focused on investing in early-stage companies building developer infrastructure (DevInfra) and SaaS products.

Name: Together AI Studio
Perks: $500k-$5M flexible funding; access to a global network of 300+ product, engineering, GTM leaders & researchers in SaaS & AI; up to $600k in credits from major cloud providers, OpenAI, and more; office hours with founders Girish and Manav; long-term engagement through company's lifecycle
Qualifications: For any founder working in AI; specialize in early investments, often at the pre product stage; looking for mission-driven teams addressing a proven pain point with a unique, defensible solution; should have a clear vision and approach
One-line description: A venture-building program focused on supporting exceptional AI founders by helping them develop their companies from idea stage to market fit and scale.

Name: Upekkha
Perks: $125k investment for 7%; $700k in partner credits
Qualifications: For B2B SaaS startups that have early revenue; $25k program fee
One-line description: A startup accelerator specifically focused on helping SaaS companies in their growth journey.

Name: NASA SBIR/STTR Program
Perks: Up to $150k in Phase I, up to $850k in Phase II, up to nearly $3M or more through Post Phase II opportunities
Qualifications: For entrepreneurs, startups, or small businesses with less than 500 employees
One-line description: A funding initiative that helps small businesses and research institutions develop and commercialize technologies that support NASA missions and solve national problems.

Name: America's Seed Fund (NSF)
Perks: Up to $305k in non-dilutive funding for research and development (R&D) to build your prototype or proof-of-concept over 6 to 18 months, up to $1.25M over the course of 24 months in Phase II, can apply for supplements that may add up to more than $500k; detailed feedback to all reviewed applications; virtual coaching from NSF program directors
Qualifications: https://www.sbir.gov/sites/default/files/elig_size_compliance_guide_0.pdf
One-line description: A program that helps startups and small businesses develop their ideas and bring them to market powered by the U.S. National Science Foundation (NSF).

Name: Hessian AI LAISF
Perks: 6 months of funding for either one person full-time or two persons part-time, 30k€ material expenses
Qualifications: Should have a research-driven AI business idea, shouldn't have incorporated your company yet, no other parallel funding of project should be running, main focus is supporting research-driven ideas but may still apply even if not, if applying for scholarship funded team member needs to have a permanent residency within the Federal Republic of Germany, working besides funding is allowed up to 5 hours a week (part-time is allowed if split funding)
One-line description: A program designed to help researchers quickly test and validate their AI ideas by providing funding and support to turn research-driven AI concepts into startups.

Name: AI2 Incubator
Perks: Pre-seed investment up to $500k, upfront pre-seed investment of $150k for team and $50k for solo founder, additional $100k for solo founders who later add a co-founder or team, full $500k investment upon progress; up to $1M in AI compute; development guidance including co-founder matching, applied AI product dev support, and more
Qualifications: Should be early stage, seeking clear leadership qualities, product vision, and experience taking an idea and turning it into a product
One-line description: A Seattle-based incubator that helps entrepreneurs create AI-first startups.

Name: Betaworks' AI Camp
Perks: Access to the Betaworks shared workspace; 1-2 optional sessions per week including speed dating with investors, visits from industry leaders, workshops, founder stories, and live demos; investment up to $500k, $250k on an uncapped SAFE note with a 25% discount, 5% common stock stake in the business
Qualifications: Seeking teams that are actively selecting and adapting to the foundation layer capabilities; should focus on evident value; should deliver value quickly and are aligned with well-defined users; should focus on implementation that best serves users; should have positioning that allows for focused data collection and application; reflect deep understanding of unaddressed pain points of users; leverage deeagentic systems coupled with new business models
One-line description: A cohort-based program that helps early-stage startups develop AI-powered products.

Name: AI Grant
Perks: $250k on an uncapped SAFE; $350k in Azure credits + $250k in additional credits; Summit in San Francisco with advisors and founders; Demo Day with world-class investors
Qualifications: Focus is on pre-seed/seed-stage startups, demos are a big plus
One-line description: A non-profit, distributed research lab in San Francisco, California that funds research in AI.

Name: Paddle AI Launchpad
Perks: Mentorship from leaders across Paddle and the wider SaaS industry; exclusive benefits and masterclasses to scale product and go-to-market strategies; can connect with other AI Founders and innovators; $20k cash prize for Demo Day winner in each cohort
Qualifications: Should be AI-focused; should have minimal viable product (beyond ideation); should show clear signs of market traction and potential for growth
One-line description: A six-week program offered by the company Paddle designed to help aspiring software founders build and scale their AI-powered businesses.

Name: Llama Impact Grants
Perks: $500k grant, at least one or more organization per region can be selected to recieve $100k grant to continue iterating project
Qualifications: Must be affiliated with a valid business, non-profit organization, academic institution, or research institute in operation for at least one year; Llama should be a fundamental component of the project or product; should measurably address social impact and evaluate technical feasibility of project; should demonstrate an understanding of the target market
One-line description: A funding program offered by Meta where organizations can apply to receive financial support to develop innovative projects that use Meta's open-source AI model Llama.

Name: SPC Founder Fellowship
Perks: $400k for 7% equity via a Simple Agreement for Future Equity (SAFE); $600k in your next outside-led venture round; $200k in credits from AWS, Google Cloud, OpenAI, and more; work directly with partners several times per week (each partner works with two companies); access to alumni forum to connect with other founders in your cohort and SPC alumni
Qualifications: Idea is not needed to apply but be prepared to discuss markets you find interesting, previous ideas you have considered and discarded, and the insights you find compelling and why
One-line description: A program by South Park Commons (SPC) that supports ambitious entrepreneurs in the "idea stage" of starting a venture-scale company.

Name: Accel Atoms
Perks: Up to $1M investment as equity or convertible note; access to 70+ perks worth more than $5M from network partners; guidance from a network of 300+ startup founders, 100+ angel investors and industry experts
Qualifications: Must be a company at pre-seed stage (including idea-stage and pre-product) that has raised under $2M; based in India & Indian-origin founders based anywhere in the world
One-line description: A program by the venture capital firm Accel that supports early-stage and pre-seed founders, particularly focusing on helping them build their businesses from the "0 to 1" stage.

Name: The House AI Accelerator
Perks: $200k up to $1M on a post-money SAFE for 7-10%; up to $750k of free discounted software (including from DataBricks, Microsoft, and credits from OpenAI); access to network of AI experts including notable Cal alumni AI founders and executives
Qualifications: Must be Cal alumni, faculty, student, or affiliate entrepreneurs, especially those from underrepresented backgrounds
One-line description: A program that supports AI startups founded by Cal alumni, faculty, and students.

Name: OpenAI Startup Fund
Perks: $1M investment; support from OpenAI team through tech talks, office hours, social events, and conversations with leading practitioners
Qualifications: Founders from all backgrounds, disciplines, and experience levels are encouraged to apply
One-line description: A venture capital firm that invests in early-stage AI companies that use AI to positively impact the world, especially in fields like healthcare, education, law, science, and energy.

Name: Conviction Embed
Perks: $150K investment, uncapped, no-discount MFN SAFE; $350K in Azure credits, $250K+ of other credits including from OpenAI, Anthropic, and more; early access to Mistral models; access to a powerful AI-native community for shared learning and advantage
Qualifications: Looking for early-stage technical teams who build with velocity and pragmatism
One-line description: A highly selective program run by the venture capital firm Conviction, designed to support early-stage (pre-seed, seed-stage) founding teams building AI-native companies.

Name: AWS Generative AI Accelerator
Perks: $200k in AWS Promotional Credits, $100k in AWS Activate credits; guidance from dedicated business and technical mentors; access to alumni and investor network for mentorship, industry insights, and best practices
Qualifications: For seed and pre-seed startups; looking for machine learning startups with technical leads who are leveraging cloud technologies, ideally with an MVP already developed
One-line description: A 10-week program that helps startups develop generative AI applications globally.

Name: Greylock Edge
Perks: $500k+ in credits with AWS, Google, Microsoft and more; 3 month access to Greylock's resources, AI Researchers in Residence, hiring and customer services; flexible funding ranging from a priced seed round to an uncapped SAFE note, to no capital at all
Qualifications: For pre-idea, pre-seed and seed founders from inception to product-market fit
One-line description: A bespoke, three-month company-building program launched by Greylock Partners to support early-stage founders, including those at pre-idea, pre-seed, and seed stages.

Name: Sequoia Capital Arc
Perks: 200+ exclusive benefits including up to $350k in credits from Azure, up to $500k in savings from NVIDIA, $10k in credits from Anthropic, and much more; access to digital hub for founders with self-serve company building resources, content and Sequoia’s network rolodex; support from Sequoia Arc team in the form of weekly workshops to 1:1s with partners and operators
Qualifications: For pre-seed and seed-stage founders actively working on an idea, product and company
One-line description: A seven-week, hybrid in-person and virtual program that helps founders of seed-stage startups build companies and achieve product-market fit.

Name: Lightspeed Launch
Perks: Hands-on, company-building support led by board partner, Lighthouse platform team, and extensive operator network; access to custom-built library of early-stage playbooks and toolkits; expert-led workshops tailored to instill key skills for founders
Qualifications: For early-stage founders in the US and EU
One-line description: An exclusive company-building initiative designed for early-stage founders within Lightspeed Venture Partners' portfolio.

Name: Designer Fund Partnership
Perks: Up to $1M investment with flexible ownership terms; meetings with team and network of design experts for on-demand office hours tailored to you; hands-on support throughout design hiring process; access to community of 300+ successful founders, advisors, and design leaders from top companies
Qualifications: For early stage startups, Pre-seed to Series A; companies working to improve health, climate, or prosperity for all; mission-driven founders who value design; products that are 10x better compared to alternatives; multi-billion dollar addressable markets with poor user experiences
One-line description: An investment program offered by the Designer Fund, a venture capital firm focused on backing early-stage tech companies that prioritize design in their products.

Name: Andreessen Horowitz Talent x Opportunity
Perks: $175k investment through a Donor Advised Fund managed by the Tides Foundation; collaboration with vetted industry and subject matter experts, along with TxO alumni
Qualifications: For U.S. based businesses; consumer facing technology product in market; outside of traditional venture capital/Silicon Valley network; should be able to show proven traction/growth of business
One-line description: An initiative by venture capital firm Andreessen Horowitz (a16z) that aims to identify and support talented founders, particularly those who might be outside of traditional Silicon Valley networks.

Name: Bain & Company Founder's Studio
Perks: Venture concept sourcing and validation, backed by Bain’s global insights and expertise; access to Bain’s global client and alumni network; funding and functional support; entreprenurial training bootcamp
Qualifications: For pre-seed and seed-stage founders
One-line description: An incubator program that helps build new disruptive technology ventures that use Bain's expertise and experience in new ways.

Name: Village Global Velocity
Perks: Up to $1M investment typically on a post-money SAFE with pro-rata rights; access to Village Global network for introductions to potential customers, new hires, and expertise; up to $350k in Azure credits; OpenAI credit package of $10k and early access to tech sessions and alpha programs; Anthropic AI credits of $1.5k; curated Mastermind group with other founders at similar stages
Qualifications: For pre-seed founders who are rapidly ambitious
One-line description: A bespoke program tailored for pre-seed founders, providing capital, a peer cohort, and an extensive network to accelerate startups from inception to launch.

Name: Afore Capital Founders in Residence
Perks: $100k+ investment; access to 10,000+ potential users and design partners; fireside chats, 1:1 whiteboarding sessions, pitch practice and more; guidance from relevant, bespoke 1:1 mentor
Qualifications: For pre-seed founders who are self-motivated and ship and iterate with customers daily
One-line description: A program run by Afore Capital, a pre-seed investment firm, where early-stage founders with nascent ideas can join a cohort to develop their concept, gain access to mentorship, and potentially secure funding.

Name: LAUNCH Accelerator
Perks: $125k cash investment for 7%; meet 300+ investors and learn growth strategies; possible $250k (or pro rata) investment after accelerator
Qualifications: For pre-Series A founders with some traction who execute at a high level in markets that are important
One-line description: A program designed to rapidly accelerate the growth of early-stage startups by providing mentorship, workshops, networking opportunities, and strategic support to founders.

Name: Pear VC PearX
Perks: $250k to $2M check; access to Pear Studio; up to $650k in credits from top providers like Azure, OpenAI, AWS, Google, Anthropic, and many more
Qualifications: For any early-stage company
One-line description: An exclusive, 14-week accelerator program by Pear VC, tailored for early-stage startups aiming to enhance their success prospects.

Name: IDEO CoLab Ventures Incubation
Perks: $250k cash investment; membership in IDEO network
Qualifications: For pre-seed and seed-stage founders
One-line description: An early-stage fund that invests in and incubates startups, protocols, and digital asset.
